remarks: It is sufficient to check the Ramsey property on finite sets of size equal to the upper bound.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2015.)
statement:
rami.c $e |- C = ( a e. _V , i e. NN0 |-> { b e. ~P a | ( # ` b ) = i } ) $.
rami.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN0 ) $.
rami.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. V ) $.
rami.f $e |- ( ph -> F : R --> NN0 ) $.
ramub2.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
ramub2.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( ( # ` s ) = N /\ f : ( s C M ) --> R ) ) -> E. c e. R E. x e. ~P s ( ( F ` c ) <_ ( # ` x ) /\ ( x C M ) C_ ( `' f " { c } ) ) ) $.
ramub2 $p |- ( ph -> ( M Ramsey F ) <_ N ) $.
$d C c f s x $.
$d F c f s x $.
$d M a b c f i s x $.
$d N a c f i s x $.
$d R c f s x $.
$d V c f s x $.
$d c f ph s x $.
